head.title: Jenny Craig Puts Account in Review

identified-content.object.title: Advertising (Times Column)
identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Marketing, Advertising and PR

hedline.hl1: Jenny Craig Puts Account in Review

body.head.byline: By BILL CARTER and STUART ELLIOTT

abstract.p: Jenny Craig, operator of weight-loss centers, places its ad account in review after parting ways with Johnson/Ukropina last year; billings estimated at $28 million (S)

block.p: Jenny Craig, the operator of weight-loss centers, has placed its account in review after parting ways with its creative agency of record for the last year, Johnson/Ukropina in Irvine, Calif. Billings were estimated at $28 million.

Jenny Craig, the operator of weight-loss centers, has placed its account in review after parting ways with its creative agency of record for the last year, Johnson/Ukropina in Irvine, Calif. Billings were estimated at $28 million.

Cozette Phifer, a spokeswoman at Jenny Craig in Carlsbad, Calif., confirmed a report this week in Advertising Age. The company will hear presentations next week from selected agencies, she said, declining to identify them. A decision is expected in August. The media part of the account continues to be handled by the Los Angeles office of Carat, owned by the Aegis Group.
